intro: Sampacca cathcartii, commonly known as the Cathcart's sampacca, is a rare and striking member of the Rubiaceae family. Native to the tropical rainforests of western Africa, this plant is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from deep red to orange. It typically grows as an epiphyte, clinging to the trunks of trees in its natural habitat. The leaves are usually opposite, elliptical in shape, and have a glossy texture. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is highly sought after by plant enthusiasts and conservationists alike.
